title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Not a spill. EDP_PANEL_PWR is at 0V. Using a known-good test screen and DC-In board/cable. Fan spins, CPU is on. SMC_LID is at 3.4V. Any ideas for a next step?

title: 820-00165 No video.
message:
USB mouse working?
Next check 3V presence at pins 18/19 of J8300 for at least 1-2 seconds.
In that short time DP_INT_HPD should go high; is a sign that eDP is correctly detected.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Thanks, USB mouse is working and no voltage on pins 18 and 19. No pulse at all.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message:
Check EDP_PANEL_PWR when powering up. There will only be a pulse there if anything is wrong. 

Caps present? C8320/21 and 24/25. PRAM reset done?

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: PRAM reset but no chime. No EDP_PANEL_PWR voltage pulse. Capacitors are all there.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Uhm if there is no chime after a PRAM reset the board is not booting. Speakers and IO board connected?

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Yep, not booting, trying to figure out why not. I put another board in the exact setup I'm using to make sure all the parts were working - screen, speakers, trackpad, trackpad cable, keyboard, screen, DC-In board and cable - to make sure my test rig was working properly. No chime.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: CPU Vcore present?

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Yes, normal

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: So at this point you are sure the board does not chime? Does it do a PRAM reset? Mouse light should go off during PRAM reset.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: To change only one variable (the board) I just now plugged everything in to my test board and did a PRAM reset. Mouse light goes off, speaker chimes. Then I switched out only the logic board and did another reset - no chime and mouse light stays on. I've noticed though that the board turns off for a second (fan stops) and restarts, almost like an 820-3437 board, but just one time, and then it stays on. This will happen no matter what is plugged in and whether or not I'm trying to do a PRAM reset.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Check the resistors in the U6100 data lines, especially the ones that for from U6100 to the SMC. R6114-17

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Everything checks out there. Resistors and lines are good. I checked the diode measurements on the SMC side of the resistors and they're similar to a good board. The board had a nice layer of untouched dust on it so I'm pretty confident there was no spill. Nothing looks damaged.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Could be corrupt ROM. Got a known good ROM for testing?

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: No change with a known-good ROM chip on it. Computer still restarts about 8 seconds in. No chime.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: I have no other ideas than a bad trace or resistor in the SPI lines from the ROM. Of course check U1950 pin 8.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Ok, found that pin 7 voltage was low on ROM chip. Continuity was missing with R6131. Ran wire. Board chimes now, blinking folder and then dies about 10 seconds later. Still digging for more issues but haven't found anything yet.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: So it is a spill! Could be corrosion anywhere. pin 8 U1950 is most suspect.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: I hear you, but this board was spotless. I can't imagine any other way this could have happened besides a spill, but the board had zero signs of spill. I'm a little perplexed by this one. Either way, I'm treating it as some sort of spill and moving that way. I'll keep looking. If I'm measuring 3.4V at pin 8 of U1950 is that not evidence enough that it's good? Is there anything else that might be going wrong there despite measuring the correct voltage?

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Look at pin 8, is it corroded? Besides that it could be corrosion anywhere. Around U6100, clock chip, J6100, etc.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: No, pin 8 looks great, there's not a sign of anything looking bad on the board, but I've inspected this area closely and it looks untouched. I'll keep looking in other areas.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: I'm not seeing anything else off yet. After it shuts down it looks like a board that was turned off. There's no looping attempt to restart. I can then hit the power button and it will turn on. Something is telling/causing it to turn off.

title: 820-00165 No video.
message: Disconnected everything? It could be anything really. Voltage on SMC_ONOFF stable at 3.4V?
